name: Iberostar Papagayo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was at the Iberostar Papagayo for a wekk and just returned a couple of days ago. The hotel and grounds were lovely, absolutely spotless. Our room had a massive balcony overlooking the pool with the sea in the background. The view was stunning. The room was spotless and the cleaner changed the towels every day and the bed linen every other day. It was about a 15 minute walk to the Marina which was a lovely walk round the coast. The food was fine. I am a very fussy eater but always managed to get something I liked.
reviews.title: Brilliant Week at this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only down fall was the entertainment at night. There was a couple of shows which were very good but the entertainment on the other nights which was done by hotel staff was really poor.
reviews.title: the real family review. trust me read it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However I was just there to relax for a week and I had a great time at this hotel, will definetley return next year.
reviews.title: Real Class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Here we go then, The good points. The hotel is about 10 year old and is quite modern, very clean, helpfull staff who adore young children(a bit to much so be aware).
reviews.title: Good standard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The food selection is great as is the drinks, the rooms are quite good and the maid service is outstanding. There is a constant breeze there so its quite cool in the shade.
reviews.title: great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited the hotel for Xmas (23/12/07 - 30/12/07). We chose it after reading such favourable reviews on tripadvisor. They weren't wrong!
reviews.title: 4 star all inclusive - you bet!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The plus points: -
reviews.title: Loved Iberostar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - friendly welcome at reception
reviews.title: Good Value Short Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: - room clean & good size - had a bath & shower (we were in "basic" room so no worries if you do not upgrade)
reviews.title: Well worth considering
Brilliant short break!
reviews.text: - no queues EVER! (remember hotel was full for Xmas)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just returned from the Iberostar Papagayo and I have to say that it is a little gem of a hotel.
reviews.title: Gem of a Hotel with Lovely Views

likes.liked: — Location, views and the friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: When you first arrive, it does not look anything special but once you step into the reception you get a small taste of the views and the location on offer.
reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception staff are first class and multilingual - they cannot do enough for you and are always polite and smiling. Our room (573) was on the 5th floor and had a nice view of the pool area and the sea. We noticed that the lock on our patio door wasn't working, so reported it to reception, and 30 minutes later when we went back to the room it was fixed!!
reviews.title: very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to say that Lanzarote was one of the cleanest places I have ever been, and the Papagayo itself was spotless. There was always someone around the pool area cleaning the pool and the glass around the complex in the mornings and evenings and the maids come round every day and change the towels if needs be.
reviews.title: Great hotel and great location
what a place
reviews.text: We were on Half Board, and for €6 per person, you could have your lunch at the hotel as well. For this, you could help yourself to as much food as you want from the buffet, 1 free drink and as much ice cream as you want - which to be honest is fantastic value if you have an appetite.

reviews.title: Not Recommended For Water Babies!.....
reviews.text: Just returned from a few days at the Iberostar..... good points first:- the rooms are very clean, spacious & quiet...... the food & drinks are of excellent quality & plentiful in variety & quantity...... the staff, on the whole, are friendly & courteous..... UNFORTUNATELY, all of this was tainted by the fact that NONE of the luxurious-looking pools were anywhere near a comfortable, swimmable temperature - the one "heated" pool below the main restaurant was only around 20 degrees - far too cold for all but the hardiest. We complained several times to reception, but were fobbed off with tales of "none of Iberostar's hotels have pools heated above 24 degrees, in order to reduce the risk of problems for people with skin conditions"!!..... so, the pool was constantly deserted, which is very dissappointing for those people, like ourselves, travelling with young children, for which a warm pool is the prime source of daytime entertainment.... on the third day of our stay we walked up to the Papagayo Arena hotel, which had a completely different atmosphere solely because it had a heated pool alive with happy swimmers of all ages.... I would strongly recommend paying the extra & staying at the Arena....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: food bland and boring- all tasted the same! could only get a snack ie sandwich after 3pm ( due to hotel catering mainly for AI)
reviews.title: not impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: No room service- which one would expect for it,s rating. rude head receptionist- and majority of staff seemed unhappy with their lot!Defniteley not a 4*- more like a 3* plus. The only person who was both extremely pleasant and really helpful was Else on reception. Entertainment pathetic.However good size rooms, and nice pool area. I would defnitely not go back
reviews.title: The Jury is out ????

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hi there here is a run down of what we thought of the Iberostar Papagayo.
reviews.title: Loved our holiday but...

likes.disliked: — Not getting room we thought we'd booked and pool emptied for renovations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: As the report earlier stated that the main pool was out of commision, we arrived on the 27/01/08 when they where emptying it and it was not fully fixed and up and running until the the 02/02/08, which I think is totally disgraceful.
reviews.title: Great for young families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Iberostar Papagayo is a nicely located, comfortable four star hotel, perfect for families with small children. It's located right next to the promenade and not too far away from Playa Blanca, a walk that can easily be done with a pram. If you have slighly older children, the walk to the gorgeous Papagayo beaches is only about half an hour.
reviews.title: Great hotel for families with small children

likes.disliked: — Not enough sun beds and balcony seats for the number of guests, repeating dishes at buffet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We are a family of three with a small eighteen month old boy, and not once did we feel guilty for bringing such a small child along for this holiday.
reviews.title: Pleasant Location

likes.liked: — service in the restauranjt friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very helpful and very good with children in general. The rooms were spacious and well-maintained, the pool had a baby and child section next to the larger adult pool.
reviews.title: A Very Relaxing Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008
reviews.text: We chose the all-inclusive option, which turned out to be perfect when you have a toddler along. Wine, beer, soft drinks and most cocktails were included in the price, as were two full buffets (noon and evening) and fruit and snacks in the afternoon.
reviews.title: Relaxing Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The noon buffet was perfect for us, allowing us to pick a healthy meal for our boy. In general, there was a good choice of local dishes, fish and meat dishes and a good selection of various salads and fruit and vegetables.
reviews.title: High Chill factor..
Good value and position but food uninspiring! See directions to find it!
reviews.text: I agree with much of what has been written recently. We've just returned from a week at the Iberostar, staying half-board and paying just over £100 per night (via Portal Interactiv.) That's not a lot for a hotel of this standard but don't expect a great culinary experience- plenty to choose from but not much variety, and tinned fruit (peaches,pineapple) used as mainstay for deserts. I guess it's a question of getting what one pays for - if you're a gastronome you might want to consider a B&B option here and sample some different restaurants in town. But you won't go hungry if you eat here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do hire a car - excellent value - we paid £81 for a weeks hire in a comfortable 4 seater and fuel is relatively cheap on the Island.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Easiest route for finding hotel:
reviews.title: Silver star for the Iberostar Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (Lots of recent building in Playa Blanca - we thought we knew the location having been here before so follow this to avoid frustration!)
reviews.title: Yaiza looked nicer !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008
reviews.text: From Yaiza main road comes into PB at roundabout with filling station. Go straight on. At next roundabout turn left, signed Femes into Avinda de Femes. Go straight over next mini roundabout and turn right at next cross roads into Maciot. This will bring you to junction oposite Princess Yaiza where you turn left into Avinda Papagayo. Go over next two roundabouts and at the third roundabout bear right. Iberostar is signed at the next mini roundabout, turn right and continue nearly to end of the road over mini-roundabouts.
reviews.title: A week at the Iberostar Papagayo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the time we booked to stay here, it was the top-rated hotel by Tripadvisor contributors. I would have to say that this is undeserved, unless all the other hotels in the area are poor, which I doubt.
reviews.title: Didn't live up to expectations
Honest comments on a good hotel
reviews.text: We stayed for a week on a half-board basis. The location of the hotel is well outside Playa Banca and quite a distance even from the Marina Rubicon. As we had rented a car (which I would recommend for Lanzarote visitors), this was not a big problem for us, but it might not suit others. From the hotel, you can walk to the town or to the fine Papagayo beaches, but either walk will take maybe 40 minutes and you're scrambling over quite rough terrain to get to the beaches.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located in a quiet residential area, so any noise will come from within the hotel and not from elsewhere. There is a decent Netto supermarket very close and parking is plentiful and free.
reviews.title: excellent choice for people of a certain age!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the hotel itself, staff are friendly and helpful and good English is spoken at reception. The rooms are very average - the decor in our room was very tired - the walls were rough and in need of replastering and the room facilities were scant. There was a space to sit outside the room on a ground-floor terrace, but this was shaded from sun by a wall - so no view as such and little reason to use the terrace. We didn't use the (outside) pool, but it would have been close to the room if we had wanted to. There is a lot of tiling in the rooms and corridors and this means that other guests walking around can be inadvertently noisy.
reviews.title: Excellent

likes.liked: — Its location and choice of food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Too many things cost extra - if you want to use your room safe, they want a payment AND a returnable deposit. If you want to use the remote for your TV, you have to pay a deposit. If you want to borrow towels to use by the pool you have to pay a deposit. Maybe they've had their fingers burned by light-fingered or absent-minded guests, but that shouldn't become the problem of honest visitors.
reviews.title: Very average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: we have stayed here four times and it is the same staff exept the manager when we were out at new yearjennifer was acting manager and she was every bit as good as the last manager the waiters are fantastic very helpful and kind most people are dutch german french etc.and all go back time and time again we are booked up to go back in september I dont know who trains the staff but they do a great job hotel food is very good and a great selection new year gala night is amazing lobster crab every kind of meats you can think of it is a very quiet holiday to describe it I would say it is a JEWEL IN A CROWN
reviews.title: staff are the best we have ever known

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The resort - Playa Blanca in the south of Lanzarote is laid back and spacious. A main street, partly traffic and partly pedestrian, runs through its centre, with the usual Canarian tourist shops, and eateries. The resorts jewel is the Rubicon Marina with an upmarket feel. Dont come here for foam parties and "English pub / breakfast".
reviews.title: Papagayo _ give it a go !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: By car the Iberostar Papagayo is 10 minutes from the centre or 5 minutes from the marina. Alternatively, an attractive cliff top promenade makes an easy 45 minute walk to the marina. A Netto, 150 yards from the hotel has daily papers, magazines and other provisions. We noted English, German, Dutch, Italian, French and Spanish visitors at the hotel, with no one nation predominating. Reception staff are helpful and efficient (Bert is a multilingual star). A hiccup in our booking was rapidly resolved with an upgrade for half our 4some to a suite.
reviews.title: Lovely Holiday superb holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008
reviews.text: Rooms are bright, spacious, air-conditioned and very well tended by daily maid service. All have a terrace or balcony which catches the sun at some time. Sea views towards Papagayo beach and Fuerteventura are spectacular. Fridge (free), TV (free, but charge for remote is pointless as it only has Eurosport and SkyNews in English), safe (small charge), superb shower, plenty of wardrobe space.
reviews.title: GOOD BUT NOT GREAT IBEROSTAR PAPAGYO

likes.liked: — GREAT STAFF, CLEAN AND FLEXIBILITY OF APARTHOTEL
likes.disliked: — COLD POOL, POOR KIDS FACILITIES AND FREEZING POOL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Buffet food can be repetitive, but there is enough choice to suit everyone. The black-tiled pool looks strangely forbidding, but there was no shortage of sunbeds, ever . Evening entertainment varied from superb African gymnasts to the naff but very enthusiastic hotel animacion team.
reviews.title: perfect hotel, location staff food fantastic

description: The location of this hotel is just one of the many reasons to choose it as your next holiday destination. Standing on the seafront opposite Las Coloradas Beach, it is also just a short distance from the famous Papagayo Beaches, renowned as being the best on Lanzarote thanks to their golden sands and transparent turquoise waters.This complex offers you and your family a host of leisure options including the chance to unwind in our personal care and spa zone, the magnificent peaceful beaches and the nudist zone on the hotel roof, as well as fun in the pools, plus a wide range of leisure and gastronomy options. This hotel has 208 rooms and 83 apartments, and the very best facilities, including a restaurant, bar, lounge bar, Internet points, boutique, 3 freshwater pools, a solarium-terrace with hammocks and sunshades, a pool bar and a nudist zone on the roof. We also offer a fitness rooms where guests may work out and modern tennis courts. You may also practise aerobics, archery and rifle shooting, as well as billiards, darts, spinning, squash, water polo, football and tennis, all without stepping foot outside the complex. But if you prefer other sports, there is a golf course within easy reach of the hotel and we also have a bicycle hire service. Our entertainment team put on a superb programme of activities: during the day, guests can take part in the games and sports, and in the evening there’s dancing, disco music and professional shows for the whole family. There are also a range of facilities especially for kids, such as the Maxiclub (for children aged between 9 and 12), offering games, sports and a choice of activities including the Minidisco. We also offer an evening babysitting service so mums and dads can enjoy a relaxing dinner with complete peace of mind. The hotel also offers guests a choice selection of buffet dishes in the Lancelot Restaurant or El Junco Pool Snack Bar. Relax after a day in the sun over a drink in the quiet Flamingo Lobby Bar or the livelier Timanfaya Theatre Bar. Visit the hotel’s Minispa and indulge in an exclusive relaxing treatment including the hammam, caldarium, two hydromassage tubs, cold water baths and a range of massages. The hotel's modern facilities also make it the ideal venue for business meetings and conventions. We have two large, fully-equipped rooms with seating for between 25 and 80 people plus a team of skilled professionals at your service. Participants in these events also have full access to the hotel’s leisure facilities. A superb climate, magnificent beaches and outstanding facilities make this hotel the perfect holiday destination.
